newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil sells 100 pct of coffee offered in sale.
newsitem.headline: Brazil sells 100 pct of coffee offered in sale.

text.p: The Brazilian government sold 100 percent of the 42,250 60-kg bags of coffee stocks offered to all segments of the coffee sector in its auction today, according to Banco do Brasil which held the auction.
Total revenue for the government was 7.20 million reais ($6.73 million).
Closing prices were as much as nine reais higher than opening levels set by the government.
Last week an auction of 150,000 bags also saw good demand with almost a total sell-out at prices up to 20 reais higher than starting levels.
The sale is the last scheduled auction in the 1996/97 year (July/June).
Today the Sao Paulo State Coffee Industry Union called for new auctions immediately to try and ease the tight supply situation which it said is already causing problems for domestic roasters.
Opening and closing prices in reais per bag per lot were as follows:
